project.teaser: The main contribution of EqualStrength is to investigate cumulative and structural forms of discrimination, outgroup prejudice and hate crimes against ethnic, racial and religious minorities from a cross-setting and intersectional perspective. We deploy innovative, targetted...
project.objective:
The main contribution of EqualStrength is to investigate cumulative and structural forms of discrimination, outgroup prejudice and hate crimes against ethnic, racial and religious minorities from a cross-setting and intersectional perspective. We deploy innovative, targetted and effective methods, which include field experiments, population-level secondary survey data, meso-level policy analysis and targeted data collection to include the perspective of minority groups who directly confront discrimination.
Our approach allows us to meet five interrelated research objectives:
First, we reveal structural and cumulative forms of ethnic and racial discrimination in Europe, focusing on the experience of Muslim, Roma and Black minorities. Second, we assess the systemic nature of prejudice across life domains, targetting anti-Muslim, anti-Black and anti-Roma attitudes. Third, we analyse policy and institutional factors that contribute to structural discrimination and prejudices. Fourth, we document the lived experiences and coping strategies adopted to confront everyday discrimination. And finally, we highlight the intersection of race, ethnicity and religion with other dimensions of inequality such as gender, sexual orientation, and socioeconomic position.
In meeting these objectives, we promise three key contributions:
First, we shift the paradigm, moving from a focus on individuals at risk to a family perspective. Second, we reveal cumulative, structural and intersectional disadvantage, pushing beyond setting-specific and single-group discrimination. Third, we provide a multi-actor and multi-level perspective that simultaneously considers multiple actors (i.e. gatekeepers; ethnic, racial and religious minorities; majority groups) and levels of analysis (i.e. the micro-level of individual decisions; the meso-level of organisations, neighbourhoods, rental agencies and childcare facilities; the macro-level of countries and nation-wide institutions).
project.title: From one closed door to another: Cumulative discrimination and prejudice against marginalised groups in Europe
project.keywords: Discrimination, racism, xenophobia, prejudice, hate crime, ethnic inequalities, Islamophobia, intersectionality, Roma, Anti-Gypsyism

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - EQUALSTRENGTH (From one closed door to another: Cumulative discrimination and prejudice against marginalised groups in Europe)
result.teaser: The main contribution of EqualStrength is to investigate cumulative and structural forms of discrimination, outgroup prejudice and hate crimes against ethnic, racial and religious minorities from a cross-setting and intersectional perspective. We deploy innovative, targetted...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Research design of WP3 on contextual effects
result.description: Finalization of general research design of WP3 on contextual effects on discrimination and prejudices

result.title: Data inventory of perceptions of discrimination and hate crimes
result.description: Data inventory of international and national surveys with ethnic minority and/or migrant samples and modules on discrimination or hate crime

result.title: Stakeholders input summary
result.description: Document summarising stakeholders’ input on topic priorities and research design, based on meetings/small survey.

result.title: Launch Event
result.description: Event to mark the start of the project and bring together all members of the consortium, Advisory Board and the European Commission.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan (DMP) will be fully drafted and available. An update version will be uploaded for every reporting period.

result.title: Research design of online survey
result.description: Harmonized research design of the online survey will be finalized.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and impact
result.description: Detailed strategy for communication, dissemination and exploitation of the projects’ outputs. An update version will be uploaded for every reporting period.

result.title: Research design of minority survey
result.description: Refinement of research design of conjoint survey experiment based on literature review and input from stakeholders and focus groups

result.title: Research design
result.description: Harmonized research design of the field experiments will be finalized, including the preparation of experimental protocols and materials.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
